biogHist.abstract: The Arthur Harrison Boys' Home in Hawthorn was established in 1960. It provided accommodation for homeless boys coming from the country to the city, including residents of Kilmany Park. In 1978 it changed its name to Harrison House Youth Hostel.
biogHist.p: The Presbyterian Church ran a 'sister project' to Arthur Harrison, called Regent House Hostel for Girls in Elwood.

The home was named after a former Director of Social Services of the Presbyterian Church, Arthur G. Harrison.
In 1978 it was renamed Harrison House Youth Hostel.
In 1982 as it expanded its range of services, it became Harrison House Youth Services.

In 1985 Harrison House Youth Services helped a community group to establish 'Courtney Youth Services' in North Melbourne. Courtney Youth Services set up Hotham Hostel, a specialist youth hostel for girls. Courtney Youth Services became autonomous in 1988.

By 1986, the agency had been through several name changes, its program had 7 houses and also included girls at risk of homelessness. Harrison House Youth Services closed its Power Street hostel in 1987/88 and moved its hostel operations to an existing facility in Mitcham. A new project, 'Harrison Industries', commenced in the same year.
By 1991, Harrison Youth Services operated 11 houses and in 1992 moved its administrative headquarters to Wantirna. In 1993, it merged with the Waverley Youth Housing Group.
In 1994 the name changed again to Harrison Community Services reflecting a broadening of services delivered by the agency.

Harrison Community Services withdrew from residential care provision in the late 1990s, following its publication of a strong critique of the 'care' system in 1999 (Stephen McGarry's 'In place of the good parent', published by Harrison Community Services).
In 2000, Harrison Community Services joined UnitingCare.

In July 2001, it merged with Genesis in Blackburn. The agency provides some limited respite accommodation, supported accommodation for homeless people and accommodation for people with a disability. UnitingCare - Harrison Community Services has its head office in Knox and provides family services with a focus on early intervention, prevention, family and individual support.
Harrison Community Services does not hold any records relating to the Arthur Harrison Boys' Homes.
In the past, Harrison Community Services only retained records relating to statutory clients for a period of 7 years. However, all client files created after 2004 are kept indefinitely.

chronItem.event: Location - Arthur Harrison Boys' Home was located in Power Street, Hawthorn

descriptiveNote.p: Regent House was a 'sister' program to Arthur Harrison Boys' Home

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Kilmany Park Farm Home for Boys (1923 - 1978)

descriptiveNote.p: Some former residents of Kilmany Park were accommodated at Arthur Harrison Boys' Home when they moved to Melbourne.
UnitingCare Harrison Community Services is part of the UnitingCare Victoria and Tasmania network.
